name: Login as nobody (freebsd)
description: An adversary may try to re-purpose a system account to appear legitimate. In this test change the login shell of the nobody account, change its password to nobody, su to nobody, exit, then reset nobody's shell to /usr/sbin/nologin.

data.command:
cat /etc/passwd |grep nobody 
# -> nobody:x:65534:65534:Unprivileged user:/nonexistent:/usr/sbin/nologin
pw usermod nobody -s /bin/sh
echo $(openssl passwd -1 art) | pw mod user nobody -h 0
su nobody
whoami
exit

pw usermod nobody -s /usr/sbin/nologin
cat /etc/passwd |grep nobody
# -> nobody:*:65534:65534:Unprivileged user:/nonexistent:/usr/sbin/nologin
